intro: Taraxacum illyricum, commonly known as the Illyrian dandelion, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust rhizomatous root system. The plant produces a yellow flower that matures into a white, fluffy seed head, typical of the dandelion genus. Its leaves are basal, alternate, and covered in fine hairs, while the stem is upright and often hairy. Taraxacum illyricum is adapted to grow in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides.
